result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Samuel Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
*If all of the conditions of probation are met prior to the 16 months of probation, the agent can bring this into court to terminate the probation earlier.
*Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
*Pay supervision fees.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample.
*No contact with the victims unless approved by the court.   Defendant may have 3rd party contact and contact by phone to have time with the child/ren.

*Complete batterer's intervention program.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Samuel Gonzalez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Jesus Samuel Gonzalez in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

As to count 1:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 16 months, with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with the victims unless approved by the court.   Defendant may have 3rd party contact and contact by phone to have time with the child/ren.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.

 
If all of the conditions of probation are met prior to the 16 months of probation, the agent can bring this into court to terminate the probation earlier.
.
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief; memorandum for conditions of probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
.
The next court date is in Branch 36.  
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jesus Samuel Gonzalez in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Jesus Samuel Gonzalez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
